snippet: Nurses and home aides had a difficult decision to make when Hurricane Sandy hit: risk their lives and go out in the storm to continue providing help to patients who depend on them or to stay at home.
abstract: Tens of thousands of New Yorkers who depend on home medical care remained tenuously connected to critical services during Hurricane Sandy; more than 5,000 nurses, aides and social workers at the Visiting Nurse Service of New York alone were out serving patients around the city.
